title: Trump vows tariffs on eight European nations over Greenland
byline: President Donald Trump on Saturday vowed to implement a wave of increasing tariffs on European allies until the United States is allowed to buy Greenland, escalating a row over the future of Denmark’s vast Arctic island.

title: 10 of 30 key Presidential promises met, 10 more in progress by November: Anura Meter
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has fulfilled 10 of his key election promises by November 2025, while a further 10 are currently in progress, according to the latest update of the ’Anura Meter’ manifesto tracker.

title: Artemis II: Nasa’s mega Moon rocket arrives at launch pad
byline: Nasa’s mega rocket has been moved to the launch pad in Cape Canaveral, Florida, as the final preparations get underway for the first crewed mission to the Moon in more than 50 years.

title: Nandana Gunathilake passes away
byline: One time Presidential candidate and former Mayor of Panadura, Nandana Gunathilake passed away early in the morning today, a close associate said.

title: Special circular issued for public officials during Ramadan season
byline: A special circular has been issued directing public officials to accommodate religious observances during the upcoming Ramadan season.

title: Wreckage of Indonesian surveillance plane that went missing found in South Sulawesi
byline: Indonesian authorities have found the wreckage of a surveillance aircraft that went missing in South Sulawesi, but all 11 people on board are still unaccounted for.

title: Bus overturns in Haldummulla; Driver killed
byline: A bus travelling from Colombo to Welimada overturned in the Uvathenna area of Haldummulla, resulting in the death of the driver, police said.

title: Trump vows tariffs on eight European nations over Greenland
byline: President Donald Trump on Saturday vowed to implement a wave of increasing tariffs on European allies until the United States is allowed to buy Greenland, escalating a row over the future of Denmark’s vast Arctic island.

title: Nandana Gunathilake is zero to me: Lal Kantha
byline: “Nandana Gunathilake is zero to me,” Minister K. D. Lal Kantha said, referring to his former comrade who passed away today.

title: Two petitions against Parliamentary Pensions repeal
byline: Two Special Determination petitions have been filed before the Supreme Court challenging the constitutionality of the proposed legislation seeking to repeal the Parliamentary Pensions Act.

title: Iran’s Khamenei says US, Israel links behind ‘thousands killed’ in protests
byline: Iran’s Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei says actors linked to the United States and Israel were responsible for killing “several thousands” of people during weeks of antigovernment protests in the country.

title: Medical specialists demand separate service minute
byline: The Association of Medical Specialists (AMS) has raised serious concerns over what it describes as attempts by a group of medical officers to sabotage a Cabinet-backed initiative to resolve long-standing grievances of government medical specialists, including the introduction of a separate service minute.

title: Police warn public about social media and phone scams
byline: The Sri Lanka Police have reported a rise in complaints across the country about fraudsters using social media platforms and phone calls to illegally transfer money from victims’ bank accounts.

title: Northern railway line to be closed temporarily for renovation
byline: The Northern railway line, which was severely damaged by Cyclone Ditwah, will be temporarily closed at several sections starting tomorrow (January 19), the General Manager of Railways, K. Ravindra Pathmapriya said.

title: 28-year-old man shot dead in Alawwa
byline: A 28-year-old man was shot dead in Alawwa last night, police said.

title: Youth-led street racing under police radar following fatal accidents
byline: In the wake of a rising trend of youth involvement in illegal night street races, tge Sri Lanka Police have launched an intensified crackdown, cautioning that illegal and reckless racing resulting in death or injury will be dealt with under both traffic laws and the Penal Code, including charges of murder and attempted murder.
